publicFooter.description: A modern full-stack client template built with Next.js, React, and TypeScript. Everything you need to build production-ready applications.
landing.home.hero.title: Build Modern Applications with Confidence
landing.home.hero.subtitle: A production-ready client template with authentication, internationalization, role-based access control, and a beautiful admin dashboard — all built on Next.js and React.
landing.home.features.title: Everything You Need
landing.home.features.subtitle: Built with the latest technologies and best practices for modern web development.
landing.home.features.feature1.title: Authentication & Authorization
landing.home.features.feature1.descripti: Complete auth system with login, registration, password reset, role-based access control, and session management.
landing.home.features.feature2.title: Lightning Fast
landing.home.features.feature2.descripti: Static export for blazing-fast load times. Optimized builds with React 19 and the latest Next.js compiler.
landing.home.features.feature3.title: Internationalization
landing.home.features.feature3.descripti: Built-in multi-language support with URL-based locale routing and easy-to-manage translation files.
landing.home.features.feature4.title: Admin Dashboard
landing.home.features.feature4.descripti: Full-featured admin panel with user management, role management, permissions, and audit logging.
landing.home.features.feature5.title: Team Collaboration
landing.home.features.feature5.descripti: Multi-tab synchronization, event broadcasting, and real-time state management across browser tabs.
landing.home.features.feature6.title: Secure by Default
landing.home.features.feature6.descripti: Token-based authentication, route guards, permission checks, and bot protection built right in.
landing.home.cta.title: Ready to Get Started?
landing.home.cta.subtitle: Join thousands of developers building modern applications with our template. Start building today.
landing.pricing.title: Simple, Transparent Pricing
landing.pricing.subtitle: Choose the plan that best fits your needs. Upgrade or downgrade at any time.
landing.pricing.free.name: Free
landing.pricing.free.description: Perfect for personal projects and getting started.
landing.pricing.pro.name: Pro
landing.pricing.pro.description: For growing teams that need more power and flexibility.
landing.pricing.enterprise.name: Enterprise
landing.pricing.enterprise.description: For large organizations with custom requirements.
landing.announcements.title: Announcements
landing.announcements.subtitle: Stay up to date with the latest news and updates from our team.
landing.announcements.item1.title: Introducing v2.0 — A Complete Redesign
landing.announcements.item1.description: We've completely redesigned the platform from the ground up. The new version features a modern UI, improved performance, and a more intuitive user experience. Upgrade today to experience the difference.
landing.announcements.item2.title: New Enterprise Plan Available
landing.announcements.item2.description: We're excited to announce our new Enterprise plan, designed for large organizations with custom requirements. Get dedicated support, custom integrations, and SLA guarantees.
landing.announcements.item3.title: Multi-Language Support Now Live
landing.announcements.item3.description: Our platform now supports multiple languages out of the box. Switch between English and Turkish with a single click, and contribute translations for additional languages.
landing.announcements.item4.title: Improved Security Features
landing.announcements.item4.description: We've added two-factor authentication, enhanced bot protection, and improved audit logging to keep your data safe and secure. Enable these features from your account settings.
landing.blog.title: Blog
landing.blog.subtitle: Insights, tutorials, and updates from our engineering team.
landing.blog.post1.title: Building Scalable React Applications with Feature-First Architecture
landing.blog.post1.excerpt: Learn how we organize our codebase using a feature-first architecture that scales with your team. We cover folder structure, barrel exports, and separation of concerns.
landing.blog.post1.author: Alex Johnson
landing.blog.post2.title: Type-Safe API Clients: A Practical Guide
landing.blog.post2.excerpt: Explore how to build a type-safe API client using TypeScript generics, Zod validation, and TanStack Query for reliable data fetching with full type inference.
landing.blog.post2.author: Sarah Chen
landing.blog.post3.title: Internationalization in Next.js Without Server-Side Rendering
landing.blog.post3.excerpt: A deep dive into implementing i18n in a statically exported Next.js application using URL-based locale routing and client-side translation loading.
landing.blog.post3.author: Mike Torres
landing.blog.post4.title: Role-Based Access Control Patterns for Modern Web Apps
landing.blog.post4.excerpt: Implement fine-grained access control using guards, permissions, and route protection. Learn patterns for both UI rendering and API-level authorization.
landing.blog.post4.author: Emily Park
landing.blog.post1.content1: Feature-first architecture is a pattern where code is organized by features rather than by technical concerns. Instead of grouping all components, hooks, and services in separate directories, each feature contains everything it needs to function independently.
landing.blog.post1.content2: In our template, each feature lives under src/features/<name>/ and contains its own components, hooks, services, schemas, guards, types, and a barrel index.ts file. This approach makes it easy to find related code and understand the boundaries of each feature.
landing.blog.post1.content3: Barrel exports via index.ts files provide a clean public API for each feature. Components outside the feature only import from the barrel, never from internal paths. This enforces encapsulation and makes refactoring safer since internal changes don't break external consumers.
landing.blog.post1.content4: As your team grows, feature-first architecture scales naturally. New developers can work on their feature in isolation without needing to understand the entire codebase. Features can be developed, tested, and even lazy-loaded independently, leading to better performance and developer experience.
landing.blog.post2.content1: Building a type-safe API client starts with defining your API contract using TypeScript interfaces. By leveraging generics, you can create a single fetch wrapper that automatically infers request and response types based on the endpoint being called.
landing.blog.post2.content2: Zod schemas serve as the bridge between runtime data and TypeScript types. Each API response is validated through a Zod schema before being used in the application. This catches malformed data at the boundary rather than letting it cause cryptic errors deep in your component tree.
landing.blog.post2.content3: TanStack Query handles the caching, deduplication, and background refetching layers. When combined with a typed API client, every useQuery and useMutation call provides full type inference from the query key to the rendered component.
landing.blog.post2.content4: The result is an API layer where TypeScript catches mistakes at compile time, Zod catches them at runtime, and TanStack Query optimizes the network layer — all working together seamlessly to provide a reliable data-fetching experience.
landing.blog.post3.content1: Implementing internationalization in a statically exported Next.js application requires a different approach than server-rendered apps. Without access to server-side middleware or headers, we rely on URL-based locale routing using a [locale] dynamic segment.
landing.blog.post3.content2: Translation files are stored as JSON in the public directory and loaded on the client side using TanStack Query. This approach leverages browser caching — once a locale file is loaded, subsequent page navigations are instant since the translations are already in the query cache.
landing.blog.post3.content3: The generateStaticParams function at the layout level ensures that every page is pre-rendered for each supported locale. Combined with the static export output mode, this produces a fully static site with separate HTML files for each locale-page combination.
landing.blog.post3.content4: Multi-tab synchronization via BroadcastChannel ensures that when a user switches language in one tab, all other tabs update immediately. This provides a seamless experience without requiring a page refresh or server round-trip.
landing.blog.post4.content1: Role-based access control (RBAC) is essential for any application with different user types. In our implementation, we use a combination of route guards, permission checks, and UI-level rendering control to create a comprehensive authorization system.
landing.blog.post4.content2: Route guards are React components that wrap protected pages. The AuthGuard checks if the user is authenticated, while permission-based guards check if the user has the required role or permission. If the check fails, the user is redirected to an appropriate page.
landing.blog.post4.content3: On the UI level, conditional rendering based on permissions ensures users only see actions they can perform. A user without the 'delete:users' permission won't see the delete button, reducing confusion and preventing unauthorized action attempts.
landing.blog.post4.content4: The key insight is that client-side guards are for UX, not security. True authorization must happen on the server. Our guards prevent accidental access and provide a polished experience, but the API layer always performs its own permission checks regardless of what the client sends.

landing.legal.privacy.title: Privacy Policy
landing.legal.privacy.section1.title: Information We Collect
landing.legal.privacy.section1.content: We collect information you provide directly to us, such as when you create an account, update your profile, or contact us for support. This includes your name, email address, and any other information you choose to provide.
landing.legal.privacy.section2.title: How We Use Your Information
landing.legal.privacy.section2.content: We use the information we collect to provide, maintain, and improve our services, process transactions, send you technical notices and support messages, and respond to your comments and questions.
landing.legal.privacy.section3.title: Information Sharing
landing.legal.privacy.section3.content: We do not share your personal information with third parties except as described in this policy. We may share information with service providers who perform services on our behalf, or when required by law.
landing.legal.privacy.section4.title: Data Security
landing.legal.privacy.section4.content: We take reasonable measures to help protect your personal information from loss, theft, misuse, unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, and destruction. All data is encrypted in transit and at rest.
landing.legal.privacy.section5.title: Cookies & Tracking
landing.legal.privacy.section5.content: We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to collect and track information about your activity on our service. You can control cookies through your browser settings and other tools.
landing.legal.privacy.section6.title: Contact Us
landing.legal.privacy.section6.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at privacy@example.com. We will respond to your inquiry within 30 business days.
landing.legal.terms.title: Terms of Service
landing.legal.terms.section1.title: Acceptance of Terms
landing.legal.terms.section1.content: By accessing or using our service, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, you may not access or use the service. We reserve the right to update these terms at any time.
landing.legal.terms.section2.title: Description of Service
landing.legal.terms.section2.content: Our platform provides a web application template with authentication, user management, and administrative tools. The service is provided on an 'as is' and 'as available' basis without warranties of any kind.
landing.legal.terms.section3.title: User Accounts
landing.legal.terms.section3.content: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and for all activities that occur under your account. You must notify us immediately of any unauthorized use of your account.
landing.legal.terms.section4.title: Acceptable Use
landing.legal.terms.section4.content: You agree not to use the service for any unlawful purpose or in any way that could damage, disable, or impair the service. You may not attempt to gain unauthorized access to any part of the service or its related systems.
landing.legal.terms.section5.title: Limitation of Liability
landing.legal.terms.section5.content: In no event shall we be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising out of or relating to your use of the service, whether based on warranty, contract, tort, or any other legal theory.
landing.legal.terms.section6.title: Governing Law
landing.legal.terms.section6.content: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the jurisdiction in which the company is established. Any disputes arising from these terms shall be resolved through binding arbitration.

landing.faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
landing.faqs.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our platform.
landing.faqs.item1.question: What technologies does this template use?
landing.faqs.item1.answer: This template is built with Next.js 16, React 19, TypeScript 5, Tailwind CSS v4, shadcn/ui, TanStack Query, Zod for validation, and Zustand for state management. It uses MSW (Mock Service Worker) for API mocking during development.
landing.faqs.item2.question: Is this template suitable for production use?
landing.faqs.item2.answer: This template is designed as a starting point for production applications. It includes authentication, authorization, i18n, and admin features out of the box. However, you should replace the MSW mock backend with your actual API before deploying to production.
landing.faqs.item3.question: How does authentication work?
landing.faqs.item3.answer: Authentication uses token-based sessions stored in sessionStorage. The auth flow includes login, registration, password reset with OTP verification, and automatic token refresh. Route guards protect authenticated pages, and the Zustand auth store manages the global auth state.
landing.faqs.item4.question: Can I add more languages?
landing.faqs.item4.answer: Yes! Simply create a new JSON translation file in public/locales/ (e.g., de.json for German), add the locale code to the SUPPORTED_LOCALES array in the i18n configuration, and the system will automatically generate static pages for the new locale.
landing.faqs.item5.question: How do I deploy this application?
landing.faqs.item5.answer: Since the app uses static export, you can deploy the generated out/ directory to any static hosting provider such as Vercel, Netlify, AWS S3 + CloudFront, or GitHub Pages. Run 'npm run build' to generate the static files.
landing.faqs.item6.question: What is the feature-first architecture?
landing.faqs.item6.answer: Feature-first architecture organizes code by business feature rather than technical concern. Each feature (auth, admin, i18n, etc.) lives in its own directory under src/features/ with its own components, hooks, services, and types. This makes the codebase easier to navigate and scale.
landing.faqs.item7.question: How do I customize the theme?
landing.faqs.item7.answer: The template uses Tailwind CSS v4 with CSS custom properties for theming. You can modify the color tokens in your CSS file to change the entire look and feel. The theme toggle supports light and dark modes with system preference detection and multi-tab synchronization.
landing.faqs.item8.question: Is the admin panel role-based?
landing.faqs.item8.answer: Yes, the admin panel uses role-based access control (RBAC). Users are assigned roles, and roles have specific permissions. Route guards and UI-level checks ensure users only see and access features they're authorized to use. The admin can manage users, roles, and permissions.
landing.status.title: System Status
landing.status.subtitle: Current system health and recent incidents.
landing.status.service1.name: API Gateway
landing.status.service2.name: Web Dashboard
landing.status.service3.name: Authentication Service
landing.status.service4.name: CDN & Static Assets
landing.status.service5.name: Database Cluster
landing.status.incident1.title: Elevated API Latency in EU Region
landing.status.incident1.description: We experienced increased API response times in the EU-West region due to a network configuration issue. The problem was identified and resolved within 45 minutes. No data was lost.
landing.status.incident2.title: CDN Cache Invalidation Delay
landing.status.incident2.description: Static assets were serving stale content for approximately 20 minutes following a deployment. The CDN cache was manually purged and the issue was resolved.
landing.status.incident3.title: Scheduled Database Maintenance
landing.status.incident3.description: Planned database maintenance for performance optimization. Expected downtime is 15 minutes during off-peak hours. All data will be backed up beforehand.

landing.docs.title: Documentation
landing.docs.subtitle: Everything you need to get up and running.
landing.docs.section1.heading: Getting Started
landing.docs.section1.description: Set up your development environment in minutes.
landing.docs.section1.step1.title: Clone the Repository
landing.docs.section1.step1.content: Start by cloning the repository to your local machine. Make sure you have Node.js 18 or later and npm installed.
landing.docs.section1.step2.title: Install Dependencies
landing.docs.section1.step2.content: Install all project dependencies using npm. This will also set up the MSW service worker for API mocking.
landing.docs.section1.step3.title: Start Development Server
landing.docs.section1.step3.content: Run the development server. The application will be available at http://localhost:3000 with hot module replacement enabled.
landing.docs.section2.heading: Configuration
landing.docs.section2.description: Customize the template to fit your project needs.
landing.docs.section2.step1.title: Environment Variables
landing.docs.section2.step1.content: Create a .env.local file in the project root. Configure your API base URL and other environment-specific settings.
landing.docs.section2.step2.title: Adding a New Locale
landing.docs.section2.step2.content: To add a new language, create a translation JSON file in public/locales/ and register the locale code in the SUPPORTED_LOCALES array in src/features/i18n/types.ts.
landing.docs.section2.step3.title: Customizing the Theme
landing.docs.section2.step3.content: Modify the CSS custom properties in your global CSS file to change colors, border radius, and other design tokens. Changes apply instantly in development.
landing.docs.section3.heading: Deployment
landing.docs.section3.description: Build and deploy your application to production.
landing.docs.section3.step1.title: Build for Production
landing.docs.section3.step1.content: Run the build command to generate a fully static export in the out/ directory. All pages will be pre-rendered for each supported locale.
landing.docs.section3.step2.title: Deploy Static Files
landing.docs.section3.step2.content: Upload the out/ directory to any static hosting provider. Popular choices include Vercel, Netlify, AWS S3 with CloudFront, and GitHub Pages. No server runtime is required.
